3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (22:53): evening
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (22:54): tell me what's the best doctype.... under wich the page renders fastest? any sources on this?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:54): `doctype html4strict @ Lion28
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (22:54): Lion28, doctype html4strict: <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd">
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:54): only the first 'HTML' should be 'html' :p
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (22:55): what about xthml?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:55): do you want this document to work in Internet Explorer
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (22:56): obviously
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (22:56): I don'tmind to make some hacks...
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:56): IE doesn't support XHTML
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (22:57): ? wot? this is new to me :S
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:57): now you know
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (22:57): so why the hack there is xhtml doctype?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:58): erm, because there's an XHTML
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (22:58): and there's an XHTML because it's neater than HTML
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (22:58): can you give me some sources... I don't want to bother you hole evening :D
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:00): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_web_browsers#Web_technology_support
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (23:01): so what does IE if XHTML doctype is set?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:01): it either renders it as HTML, or it gives you a download prompt, depending on what content-type is sent
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (23:02): stupid ie
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (23:02): what abouit ie7, do you know anything about?
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (23:03): reisio: Not quite true. It renders it as very bad html. Strictly, html should do something a bit silly with things like <br />
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (23:03): Lion28: IE7 doesn't fix this, no.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:04): there is no IE7
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (23:04): fucking microsoft...
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (23:05): Fair point. IE7 will not fix this.

3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (23:06): so you think my best option is html4

4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (23:06): Eh. These days I think the best option is a well targeted tactical nuclear strike on microsoft. :)
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:07): you don't seem to have any particular reason to use XHTML anyways
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (23:07): But HTML 4.01 is indeed the better option.

4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (23:07): That would be a bad reason to use XHTML. :)
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (23:08): anyway... on the link you gave me I saw ie onmac doesnt support ajax?
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (23:08): IE on the mac is a joke.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:08): XHR on IE/Win is an ActiveX thing (5.somehting and 6, 7 is supposed to have a regular implementation)
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (23:08): But 'doesn't support ajax' isn't meaningful.
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:09): Ajax is just a buzzword meaning JavaScript + XMLHTTPRequest
3fd3735ab4064cc7161eb9842ccb20bf (23:09): oki :) I am using htmlajax php pear library so I hope they covered this thingy :)
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (23:10): so it probably just doesn't support xmlhttprequest, since it undoubtedly supports some form of javascript
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:10): IE/Mac didn't do ActiveX
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:10): If it did, then it was incomplete
